locations.name: Logan Canyon
locations.description: Beginning at the east edge of Logan, Utah; this byway provides spectacular scenery and access to great recreational areas.

locations.name: Logan Temple
locations.description: A temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. The Logan temple was built in 1884, and is the second oldest temple in Utah.

locations.name: Utah State University
locations.description: Founded in 1888, Utah State is a public land-grant research university with its main campus in Logan, Utah, United States.

locations.name: Aggie Ice Cream
locations.description: Nostalgic ice cream shop on Utah State University's campus serving a range of creative flavors.

locations.name: Cache County Fairgrounds
locations.description: Venue hosting community events, including a fair, car shows, and demolition derbies, plus trash car races.

locations.name: American West Heritage Center
locations.description: American West Heritage Center is a living history museum where pioneer life in the Old West is demonstrated through interactive exhibits & seasonal festivals

locations.name: Gossner Foods
locations.description: Gossner Foods is a family owned business with generations of cheese making experience. In addition to cheese, Gossner Foods is the pioneer in UHT (Ultra High Temperature) shelf stable milk in a variety of flavors.

locations.name: Zootah
locations.description: Zootah is a public zoo in Logan, UT with over 40 different native and exotic animals on display.
